name: Berce Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2011. We were traveling with another couple. The staff including the owner could not be more helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast on the roof garden was very good. The location is great and there were many good restaurants within walking distance. Definitely recommend this hotel and if we are ever back in Istanbul will stay at this lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Berce Hotel for five nights in July, and felt we had discovered a secret gem. It is family run and is not big or fancy, but the welcome from the manager/owner and the way he did whatever he could to help us enjoy our stay was unusual in its level of warmth (and I used to review hotels for a job!).
reviews.title: Almost too good to share

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small and quirky - two armchairs fitted so neatly into one little ante-room that there was no room for our legs if we chose to sit in them, but the choice of three tiny balconies and views of the sea made up for that. (MInd you, the view of the sea involved looking over a semi-derelict building site, and if anyone builds a house there, the view will be gone!)
reviews.title: Great room, wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Berce is in a quiet side street a five-minute walk away from the main sights of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, so you are near the sights but also get the feeling of being in a neighbourhood as well. There is a corner shop nearby where we bought bread and cheese and olives and tomatoes, beer and wine for a mellow picnic.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast at the hotel is simple but honest and good (the standard fare of yoghurt, honey, eggs, bread, olives, tomatoes, sausage and coffee), and served on a roof terrace which gives a view of the sea in one direction and a view of the Blue Mosque in another - that's the kind of view we were paying well over the odds for at fancy restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Istanbul- views and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is well situated very near mosque blue ( 300 meters) and in the midle of ancient Sultanahmet.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel well situated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We had no surprises with the quality offered, everything was ok.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife liked a lot the beautiful decoration on our bed when we arrived, terrace offer a view on sea, but the most important is that the staff is so helpful.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in ancient Sultanahmet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If i have to go back to Istambul, for sure i will go there.
reviews.title: Delightful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Berce Hotel is a gem. The location in the Sultanahmet area is perfect. It is within walking distance of the Sea of Marmara and the historical area where the Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi palace are located. It is also close to the tram. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff, particularly, the manager, Mehmet, is friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Mehmet went out of his way to recommend areas of interest and to take care of all the site seeing arrangements. Each morning there is a delious breakfast of fresh foods and local delicacies served on the rooftop terrace overlooking the sea. The hotel was a delightful find in this busy city. I wll recommend it to friends visiting Istanbul and look forward to staying there again on my next trip.
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for three nights and found the rooms, breakfast and location very very good.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mehmet was the best and is so helpful in helping to book tours, give the best advice and tips on how to get around. Be nice to remember to tip him.
reviews.title: Great value in the heart of things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not use taxis as they cheat most of the time and the trams are easy to use, Mehmet had great advice nowhere to eat as well.
reviews.title: Quiet sweet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here at the end of October. Its position is great - a 10 mins stroll to the Blue mosque, a few minutes more to Aya Sophia and then to Topcapi Palace or 20 mins brisker walk to the Grand Bazar. It's a converted house in a generally quiet back street on the edge of what seems to be becoming quiet a trendy area of boutique hotels, shops and restaurants. The room (104 front first floor) was a good size with well finished en suite - all newly refurbished in the last three years.
reviews.title: A Jewel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On the top floor is a small glazed breakfast room opening onto a large rooftop terrace - all with great views of the Marmora Sea and across to Asia. The breakfast is a good buffet selection - the usual fruits, cereals, cold meats and cheeses - plus fresh honeycomb from the owner's brother's hives - and filter coffee and tea. Delicious!
reviews.title: Small is beautifull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and there wasn't a single adverse review. Mehmet lived up to all that was said of him (and he got us the best table at both the restaurants he booked for us). He and the owner (who was always around at breakfast on the roof terrace, which has a wonderful view) were extremely attentive and helpful, as were the room staff, who were very friendly and always smiling. The rooms (104 & 105) were spacious, while room 105 had a temporary sea view (when the vacant plot opposite is built upon - which could be months or years away, who knows - the sea view will be gone). Everything was very clean. The hotel was in a good central position for visiting sites such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi and it was a wonderful area for pottering around. The only thing which I think it fair to add is that the noise of the train (which appears to stop running between about midnight and 5am) is a little disturbing, but apparently this is scheduled to be made redundant any time now. The other noise which might disturb some is the 5am (or so - it varies) call to prayer from the surrounding mosques, although we find it very evocative.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have just stayed for 4 nights at the Berce Hotel in Istanbul. We were very pleased with both the service and the location and would recommend this small Hotel to other couples. A very good breakfast was served on the top floor terrace and the wonderful Memet took care of all our questions and bookings for different restaurants - we always were given the best table.
reviews.title: Small Hotel in a good location for all the major sites in Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very good value.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: The location of the hotel close to the centre,the staff were pleasant,room was a large,no road noise,nothing was a problem,everyone is so helpful, excellent service,we like it,thank you for everything.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Istanbul.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't be more pleased with our stay at the Berce Hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful, knowledgable, and accommodating. The rooms are lovely- ours had two small balconies- and the rooftop terrace has views to die for. The owner was there to chat with each morning at breakfast, and he even helped arrange a visit to a Turkish bath for me, including round-trip travel. The breakfast buffet was generous and delicious, and we had afternoon coffee on the terrace, too. We will definitely come back here- it was perfect!
reviews.title: Needs a renovation

description: The hotel is in the center of İstanbul on a quiet neighborhood street a five minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and Hagia Sofia in Sultanahmet, the historical center of İstanbul.There are 7 exclusive and nicely decorated comfortable rooms, 4 of them with balconies.We have a terrace, where you can have your breakfast and have your drink with the magnificent view of the Marmara Sea, old town and the Blue Mosque.
